summary_points.title: Consecutive Session Surge
summary_points.summary: Indian benchmark indices extended their winning streak to five sessions, with the Nifty50 rising 69.90 points to 25,050.55 and the Sensex advancing 213.45 points to 81,857.84, reflecting robust investor sentiment and broad-based buying.

summary_points.title: IT Sector Steers Market Gains
summary_points.summary: Strong buying in the IT space drove much of Wednesday’s rally: Infosys jumped 3.88%, TCS gained 2.69%, and other software majors like Tech Mahindra and HCL Tech also posted healthy gains, underscoring the sector’s leadership in the current market upswing.

summary_points.title: IT Sector Champions Fifth Consecutive Rally
summary_points.summary: Indian benchmarks extended their winning streak for the fifth session, led by robust gains in Infosys (+3.88%) and TCS (+2.69%), which underpinned the Nifty50’s 0.28% advance and lifted the Sensex by 0.26% amid selective sectoral strength.

summary_points.title: Global Markets’ Divergent Cues Keep Investors on Edge
summary_points.summary: Asian bourses slipped on Japan’s trade data losses and US tech sell-offs, while European markets showed mixed performance earlier, leaving Indian indices sensitive to overseas developments and maintaining a cautious trading backdrop.

summary_points.title: Five-Day Winning Streak Fueled by IT Gains
summary_points.summary: Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex closed higher for the fifth straight session, driven largely by strong IT sector performance. The Nifty rose 69.90 points (0.28%) to 25,050.55, while the Sensex added 213.45 points (0.26%) to finish at 81,857.84. Infosys led gains with a 3.88% jump and TCS added 2.69%.

summary_points.title: Multi-Session Rally Extends Momentum
summary_points.summary: Indian equity indices marked their fourth and fifth consecutive daily gains, with the Sensex adding around 0.5–1% in recent sessions and the Nifty breaching significant levels. This sustained uptrend reflects healthy market breadth and continued institutional inflows supporting overall momentum.

articles.title: Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty end fifth straight positive session on IT gains
articles.snippet: The Sensex and Nifty closed higher for the fifth consecutive session, driven by strong IT sector performance.

articles.title: Stock market today: Sensex and Nifty end in green for fifth straight session
articles.snippet: Nifty50 rose 69.90 points to 25,050.55 and Sensex gained 213.45 points to 81,857.84, driven largely by strong IT sector gains such as Infosys and TCS.

articles.title: Stock market today: Nifty50 ends above 25,000; BSE Sensex up over 200 points - Times of India

gainers.reason: As an auto sector bellwether, it benefited from strong buying in auto stocks amid optimism over proposed GST reforms.
Financial stocks rallied on broad market optimism driven by expected GST rationalisation.
Realty‐linked and cement shares rose on hopes that GST changes would bolster construction and infrastructure demand.

losers.reason: Consumer durables and staples segments saw profit‐booking despite the broader market rally.
Selling pressure hit names outside the market’s leading sectors amid mixed sectoral performance.
IT sector stocks faced selling pressure, weighing on specialist Tech Mahindra shares.

market_drivers.summary: Today’s market rally was driven by a broad-based auto stock surge—spurred by reports of a potential GST cut on vehicles and Chinese assurances on rare-earth magnet supplies—alongside a sharp gain in Reliance Industries after Jio’s prepaid tariff revamp and bullish brokerage calls. Optimism around forthcoming GST reforms and a recent sovereign credit-rating upgrade, robust domestic institutional inflows and supportive global cues combined to lift the Sensex and Nifty back above key milestones.
